location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.297 of 1850 from Lieutenant-Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary to the Government Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter includes details of the death of Sheikh Syed Kahtan ben Syf, Governor of the Imam of Muscat's fort at Shinas, who is alleged to have excited insurrection against the Chief of Sohar [Suhar]. Syed Kahtan was captured and killed by Syed Ghes, brother of Said Hamood bin Azan, in revenge for the death of his sibling.
